Originally released as a double-LP in 1979, Bad Girls fully established Donna Summer
as pop icon. Replete with the epic production work of Giorgio Moroder and Pete Bellotte
in addition to Summer's own songwriting, the album unanimously validated her celebrity
with critics. Now, at long last, this crowning opus of Summer's career has received a
superb remastering as part of Universal Chronicles' Deluxe Edition Series.
